Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Hey guys, I have a coin that is listed in BarterDEX but my local wallet won't connect when I add it. I did set server=1 in my config file but still no dice. Could it be that I have the datadir on an external HD that is causing the problem?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: BarterDEX GUI looks in default locations

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Thanks. So my next question is, how do I add a coin permanently to BarterDEX? There are online instruction that say "Add coin with ONE LINE of code" but makes no reference where to actually put that one line of code

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Reference: https://support.supernet.org/support/solutions/articles/29000014804-how-get-your-coin-listed-on-barterdex

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Example code: {\"coin\":\"LTC\", \"name\": \"litecoin\", \"active\":1, \"rpcport\":9332,\"pubtype\":48, \"p2shtype\":50, \"wiftype\":176, \"txfee\":100000}

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: But where do I put this code?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
If it's here: https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/coins
then you just need to add via "Manage Coins"

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: if not, pop into #dev-tradebots and I'm sure someone can link you to the newer docs

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Ok thank you. I'm trying to add a new coin. It's a new fork of DASH so there is no pre-existing code addition for it

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: Most likely the first time anyone has attempted adding it

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You should send us a request to support@komodoplatform.com with the info from this guide Reference: https://support.supernet.org/support/solutions/articles/29000014804-how-get-your-coin-listed-on-barterdex then we will forward it to our developers

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Also you can copy cipi@komodoplatform.com

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: @Hermes thank you! I will do it this evening

Author: cipi#4502
Content: you can alsd tell me the link to the wallet source and i will take a first look, if it has everything needed, like gettxout and importaddress API call, and BIP65

Author: ./cryptkeeper#3265
Content: @cipi I sent you a link to the source code
